in_ports.name: input
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Background image, on which the contours will be drawn

in_ports.caption: image position
in_ports.name: image_position
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] Point, describing position of the background image in coordinate system of contours.
If specified, it will be used instead of "Start X/Y" parameters.
Also can contain 4 numbers min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y (rectangle); then its left top corner will be the position.

controls.caption: What to draw?
controls.name: drawnFeatures
controls.description:
Exact contours are drawn strictly at the specified coordinates as byte 0/1 value; if a point belongs to N>1 contours, the value will be N.
Object labels are just the labels (31-bit integer) of the corresponding objects, stored in contour array.
Note: indexes of contours are started FROM 1, not from 0!
In 3 last modes, contours are drawn at the pixels of corresponding boundary (internal or external), that differs from some contour points by 1.

controls.caption: Exact contours multiplier
controls.name: strictByteMultiplier
controls.description: If >1, in "exact contours" mode the result value is multiplied by this value: if a point belongs to N contours, the result value at this point will be N*(Exact contours multiplier).

controls.name: firstIndex
controls.caption: First index of contour
controls.description: First index of drawn contours; can be 0..N-1, where N = number of contours. Contours with less indexes are not drawn.

controls.name: numberOfContours
controls.caption: Number of contours to draw
controls.description:
Maximal number of drawn contours; can be 0..N-1, where N = number of source contours.
0 values is special and means "draw until the last contour": the actual number of drawn contours will be max(1,Nâˆ’K), where K = first index of contour above.

controls.name: needToProcessDiagonals
controls.caption: Enforce processing diagonals
controls.description: If set, this function draws also non-horizontal and non-vertical segments of the contours (when they exists). Such "diagonal" segments are usually considered as incorrect and should not appear while scanning binary objects, but can be added to contour array manually.

controls.caption: Default dimY (height)
controls.name: dimY
controls.description: dimX/dimY will be the sizes of result matrix, if the input background image is not specified.

controls.caption: Scale
controls.description: Scale: increase the sizes of drawn image in several times. Allows to correctly view boundaries of little objects (1-2 pixels).
controls.name: scale

controls.caption: Background start Y
controls.name: imageStartY
controls.description:
These start X/Y are subtracted from coordinates of all contour points.
If you specify background image, this can be interpreted as coordinates of left/top corner of this image tin coordinate system of contours.

controls.caption: Rand-seed for random palette (0 to generate new sequence always)
controls.name: randSeed

controls.caption: Contrast background
controls.name: contrastBackground
controls.description: Can be useful when background is int-32 matrix of labels.
